title: Binary Golay code
summary: In mathematics and electronics engineering, a binary Golay code is a type of linear error-correcting code used in digital communications. The binary Golay code, along with the ternary Golay code, has a particularly deep and interesting connection to the theory of finite sporadic groups in mathematics.[1] These codes are named in honor of Marcel J. E. Golay whose 1949 paper[2] introducing them has been called, by E. R. Berlekamp, the "best single published page" in coding theory.[3]
